Housing Lead Signal

Housing lead indicator: permits, starts momentum, and mortgage headwinds.

As of Unknown

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Housing signal is currently "Neutral" (Aug 31, 2025), indicating stable, non-directional activity.
  • This follows an "Expanding" phase observed in February 2025.
  • Current readings are moderate, not extreme expansion or contraction.

Key Dynamics:

  • The signal is driven by residential permits (PERMIT) and housing starts (HOUST).
  • Permits' 6-month annualised growth is negative (-0.163291), suggesting future moderation.
  • Housing Starts' 3-month annualised growth is positive (0.080315), showing recent momentum.
  • Mortgage rates (MORTGAGE30US) decreased from 6.95% (Jan 2025) to 6.22% (Dec 2025), potentially supportive.
  • The `Housing_Lead` metric at -0.207119 indicates moderate deceleration.

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal informs housing market activity, a key dimension of consumer demand and investment.
  • Housing is an early-to-mid cycle economic indicator.
  • It interacts with interest rate trends, consumer confidence, and employment.
  • A "Neutral" state implies market equilibrium without strong cyclical pressures.

Data & References:

  • Housing Signal Data (Internal) – Latest observation: 2025-12-31.
  • Influential data points: `Housing_Regime`, `PERMIT_6mAnn`, `HOUST_3mAnn`, `MORTGAGE30US`.
  • Additional depth: existing home sales and housing price indices.

Self-Healing

  • Weaknesses in Provided Inputs:
    • Mismatch of Data and Methodology: The provided dataframe contains data for a "Housing" signal, while the provided methodology document describes a "Capex Intent" signal using durable goods orders (1). This prevents a full, methodologically grounded analysis of the "Housing" signal's quantitative drivers.
    • Missing Methodology for Housing Signal: The specific methodology document for the "Housing" signal, which is the subject of the provided data, is not available. This limits the ability to precisely explain its composite construction and regime classification.
    • Missing URL for Data Source: The specific URL for the provided `Housing` signal dataframe is not available. This prevents inline citation of data points as per the specified format, necessitating an internal data reference.

Maximum 6 bullets total. Only confirmed, material issues.

References
